instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-1530: What is 820-1530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sometimes Not Charging / Slow Charging
threads.message:
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2009 MBP that would not charge a battery. It will run off the battery, although the customer reported it suddenly powering off when on battery power.
When the battery is plugged in not charging, the charger light remains green and never switches to Amber.
When it is charging, the light turns Amber and estimates ~5h to charge from 52-100%.


I tested with known good DCIN board, Battery, and charger.
Tested battery/charger fuses and all current sensing resistors around ISL6258A.

There is no water damage nor notable corrosion anywhere on the board.
I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Donor, but I can order an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> donor if I need something specific (2879 has <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, not ISL6258A if I need to replace that)

Any ideas?
I will leave the computer overnight to see if it charges completely. The customer recalled it only charging to somewhere near 50% when it stopped and came to us for warranty (originally battery swap).

--Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sometimes Not Charging / Slow Charging
threads.message:
a) Can this work without a battery?

b) Resistance between pins 17/18 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?

c) Resistance between pins 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sometimes Not Charging / Slow Charging
threads.message: Also check  <TRANSISTOR>Q7050</TRANSISTOR> if the rest looks ok.
